entry.title: Off the Record
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,814Chapters: 27/33Kudos: 71

Summary: As the guys started heading back onto the field, Eddie lagged behind. Part of him wanted to head back out. Throw a few more. Work on his accuracy. But, Coach had said to ice his shoulder, and he followed rules to the letter…at least on the field. When he rounded the corner toward the small athletic training room, the cool air from inside hit him like a wave…and there he was. Evan Buckley, officially part of the athletic training staff, unofficially Eddie Diaz’s favorite member of the training staff. Buck was a Sophomore, one of the student trainers assigned to baseball. He’d said something once about studying sports medicine, wanting to work with pro athletes someday. He didn’t act intimidated by the players like some of the other trainers did…didn’t treat Eddie like some kind of celebrity. It was…refreshing. Eddie hadn’t meant to notice him every time he came in…honestly, he tried not to…but something about the way Buck moved, calm and confident, made it hard to look away. Or, Eddie Díaz has the perfect life laid out for him: star pitcher, bright future, endless expectations. Off the field, though, it starts to crack when he’s drawn to Buck…the one person who refuses to play along.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 258,793Chapters: 37/?Kudos: 55

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 229,003Chapters: 37/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: We Both Know Something's Off, It's so Easy to See
entry.summary:
Author: breakyourhalo1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,184Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: “Hey, hey,” He sits down next to Buck, resting his hand on top of Buck’s. “What’s going on?” He asks. Buck lifts his head, and Eddie sees his face stained with tears. “I’m– sorry… I just-” He squeezes his eyes shut in pain and Eddie’s mind is racing. “Is it your leg?” He quickly asks. Buck nods, unable to speak. Eddie’s quick to take Buck’s boots off and helps take Buck’s turnout pants off. He carefully rolls up Buck’s pant leg, not knowing what he’s gonna find. He doesn’t remember Buck falling, or getting hurt, but he also wouldn’t put it past Buck to hide an injury. “Eddie…” Buck struggles out as he feels the fabric on his leg being lifted, only adding to the pain he’s feeling. Eddie’s able to get his pant leg rolled up to his knee, but as he’s looking, he can’t find anything. He starts feeling around to maybe see if it’s broken, but again, he doesn’t feel or see anything, only the scar from Buck’s ladder truck incident. “Is it your other leg? I don’t even remember you getting hurt. I-” “Eddie!” Buck shouts, trying to get Eddie to calm the hell down and listen to him. “I didn’t get hurt, well, at least not today.”

entry.title: A Wish Never Made
entry.summary:
Author: penpen_xo

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,558Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: “It’s Buck's birthday today.” Chimney relayed to their Captain who in turn snapped his eyes to Buck in horror. “What!?” Buck couldn’t help but flinch at his tone. “I don’t understand why you didn’t tell us though?” Eddie said quietly. Buck glanced over at his best friend who was looking equally confused and sad. He was almost glad that Bobby stormed away from the group, distracting him from Eddie's almost too soft gaze.Eddie, and his warm chocolate eyes had a way of just undoing him where he stood, and right now he was barely holding himself upright enough. “You’re all making this into a bigger deal then it is…really.” Buck tried protesting, but it was weak and thin and he knew it. “Actually, I don’t think you’re making a big enough deal of it.” Eddie shot back, the heat of brewing frustration thick on his tongue.   or   Buck’s birthday (a day he has entirely forgotten about) rolls around and the 118 find out they've actually managed to miss it the last few years. entry.title: This Place Could Be Beautiful, Right? You Could Make This Place Beautiful.
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,600Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 183

Summary: Life is no longer the same for Eddie and Buck. The last seven years of comfort and familiarity are threatened to be washed away and in its place now is a physical seperation by hundred of miles. But alas, they trudge on. Buck learns how to love himself amidst loneliness and how to let that be enough. Eddie grapples with his shifting identity and what it means to be unsure of yourself in a world that seems to be so unforgiving. Both men find love in one another and in their diverging lives. And even in the weeks and months to come, as they make their way back to one another, they realize that loving themselves is the only foundation their relationship can rest on. OR: Buck remains in LA with his lingering feelings in this new chapter of his life without Eddie by his side. Eddie is in Texas working on his relationship with Christopher. When you are a parent, you are trying to sell the world to your children. ‘Any decent realtor, walking you through a shithole, chirps on about good bones.' And both Buck and Eddie realize that to love the world, they must first love who they are in it.

entry.title: Every Story Has A Beginning, Middle, And End But Not Necessarily In That Order
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 125,603Chapters: 5/15Kudos: 85

Summary: Sometimes love doesn’t knock—it quietly moves in, settles on the couch, makes coffee in the morning, and slips into your heart when you’re too busy dancing around it to notice. And every great story has a beginning, middle, and end. But not necessarily in that order. Nothing in Eddie Diaz’s or Evan Buckley’s life has happened linearly so far, but it has occurred nevertheless. And them falling in love with one another is not another exception. OR: There are better no roommates than Evan Buckley and Eddie Diaz, and there is no state more natural for the pair of best friends than living together under one roof. They have a routine, you see. One they had down before they even lived together, but now that they do, it's like second nature. Buck, Eddie, and Christopher have a long summer ahead of them living in one house.

entry.title: You Are Here to Stay
entry.summary:
Author: Hir0

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,776Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 17

Summary: “Eds?”   Eddie hums without opening his eyes. “Yeah?”   “You ever think about… adopting?”   That wakes him up. His eyes blink open, brow furrowing slightly. “Adopting?” Buck twists around, meeting his gaze. “Yeah. I was talking to Hen this morning about Mara—about how they went through everything to get her back, and it just got me thinking.” Eddie sits up slowly, his expression thoughtful but guarded. “Thinking about what exactly?” “About us,” Buck says, the words tumbling out faster now that they’ve started. “About maybe adding to the family. Not right now…but eventually. I just… I think we’ve got more love to give, you know?” Or Buck and Eddie deciding to adopt.

entry.title: stay alive, open wide
entry.summary:
Author: dogfishmonger

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 377,162Chapters: 36/40Kudos: 917

Summary: He feels like shit when he's hungry, and he plays better when he's empty. The cold air doesn't touch him as much. The floodlights turn silvery-soft.And he likes eating. Keeps his hands busy, mouth busy, mind busy. Something to chew through, putty in the ears.Go until he can't anymore. Cycle it back out. Be ready. --OR: Buck's had on-again, off-again bulimia since he was 14.--Updates on Wednesdays. Title from Psychic Friend's "We Do Not Belong".

entry.title: Accidentally Yours
entry.summary:
Author: Anotherfanfic89

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,732Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Just me using the characters from 911 for my own amusement. New to writing fanfiction, but I've always enjoyed writing in general. Okay, so, Buck is a paramedic in this and it's a new way he meets Eddie and Chris. I plan on making is cute and full of so much sweet with a splash of drama from time to time. Yeah, I can already tell I suck at summaries. The first chapter is short, but it's just because I'm testing all this out.

entry.title: I hope you can see if you read through these lines (that I wrote this song about you)
entry.summary:
Author: QueerQuery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,893Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 6

Summary: Maybe he is going to look.Because maybe he really can’t stand the thought of never getting another glimpse into the beautiful mosaic that is Evan Buckley’s mind.So. Before he can think better of it. Before the guilt hits about looking in his dying partner’s personal journal, he snatches it from where it’s been lying on the floor, wipes the last of his tears with the sleeve of Buck’s hoodie, and begins reading.~~Buck and Eddie getting together through Buck's journal entries
